title: Report
description: Defines the report of all metadata elements.

anyOf.title: File
anyOf.description: Represents a file, which is either the original input file, a file dispatched by the parser, or a supplemental file generated by the parser

anyOf.title: Alphabet
anyOf.description: Generic baseXX alphabet

anyOf.title: Command
anyOf.description: Shell command

anyOf.title: Credential
anyOf.description: Collection of username and password used as credentials.

anyOf.title: CryptoAddress
anyOf.description: A cryptocurrency address and its symbol.

anyOf.title: DecodedString
anyOf.description: Extracted decrypted or decoded string.

anyOf.title: EncryptionKey
anyOf.description: Encryption, encoding, or obfuscation key.

anyOf.title: EmailAddress
anyOf.description: Email address

anyOf.title: EncryptionKey
anyOf.description: Encryption, encoding, or obfuscation key.

anyOf.title: Event
anyOf.description: Event object

anyOf.title: File
anyOf.description: Represents a file, which is either the original input file, a file dispatched by the parser, or a supplemental file generated by the parser

anyOf.title: InjectionProcess
anyOf.description: Process into which malware is injected. Usually this is a process name but it may take other forms such as a filename of the executable.

anyOf.title: Interval
anyOf.description: Time malware waits between beacons or other activity given in seconds.

anyOf.title: IntervalLegacy
anyOf.description: Legacy version of interval that uses a string type instead of float in order to preserve original display of the interval. This was done in order to ensure the decimal is either included or not depending on what the user provides.

anyOf.title: MissionID
anyOf.description: Attacker specified identifier encoded in malware, usually reflected in beacons and often related to target or time of attack.

anyOf.title: Mutex
anyOf.description: Mutex name used to prevent multiple executions of malware

anyOf.title: Network
anyOf.description: A collection of URL, Socket and Credential to relate them together

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: RFC 3986 URL

anyOf.title: Socket
anyOf.description: A collection of address, port, and protocol used together to make a socket connection.

anyOf.title: Credential
anyOf.description: Collection of username and password used as credentials.

anyOf.title: Other
anyOf.description: All other items that don't fit within the existing declared schema. Value type is determined by the "value_format" property.

anyOf.title: Path
anyOf.description: Filesystem path used by malware.

anyOf.title: Pipe
anyOf.description: Named, one-way or duplex pipe for communication between the pipe server and one or more pipe clients.

anyOf.title: Registry
anyOf.description: Registry key, value (or name), and data. (see docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/sysinfo/structure-of-the-registry)

anyOf.title: RSAPrivateKey
anyOf.description: RSA private key containing: public exponent, modulus, private exponent (d), p, q, d mod (p-1), d mod (q-1), q inv mod p

anyOf.title: RSAPublicKey
anyOf.description: RSA public key containing: public_exponent, modulus

anyOf.title: ScheduledTask
anyOf.description: A Windows Scheduled task

anyOf.title: Credential
anyOf.description: Collection of username and password used as credentials.

anyOf.title: Service
anyOf.description: Windows service information

anyOf.title: Socket
anyOf.description: A collection of address, port, and protocol used together to make a socket connection.

anyOf.title: SSLCertSHA1
anyOf.description: SSL Certificate SHA-1 Hash

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: RFC 3986 URL

anyOf.title: UserAgent
anyOf.description: Software identifier used by malware

anyOf.title: UUID
anyOf.description: A 128-bit number used to identify information, also referred to as a GUID.

anyOf.title: UUIDLegacy
anyOf.description: Legacy version of UUID that doesn't validate or convert the uuid in order to ensure the original raw strings is displayed.

anyOf.title: Version
anyOf.description: The version of the malware. To the degree possible this should be based directly on artifacts from the malware.
